general_advisory: Farmers are advised to maintain optimum water level & monitor the incidence of Yellow Stem Borer, Leaf folder & Mealy bug in rice crop. In rain deficit condition make necessary arrangement for irrigation to Rice & vegetable crops.

advisory: Provide needful irrigation to rice crops.
Prevailing dry spell may lead to an increase in the infestation of rice mealy bug, so foliar spray of Lambda cyahalothrin 4.9CS @250ml/acre is advised.

Due to low rainfall & high temperature in the last 3 days, if the damage of stem borer is observed above ETL i.e. 5% dead heart & 10% leaf damage respectively, soil application of Rynaxypyr 0.4 G@4 kg/acre or Flubendiamide 0.7 G 5kg/acre is advised.
Top dressing of fertilizer is advised 16kg nitrogen per acre within 21 days after transplanting.
For effective weed management, spray Bis-pyribic Na @80ml/acre recommended within 15-25 days after transplanting.

Current weather conditions favor blast and bacterial blight disease in rice nurseries & main field. If blast is noticed, apply 120gm Tricyclazole 75% W.P. and for Bacterial Blight apply 500g Copper Oxichloride 50% W. P. with 200g Plantomycin in 200 liters of water per acre.
Cut the branches during inter-crop to enhance growth.

Current rainy weather is favorable for the attack of insect pests like semilooper, Bihari hair caterpillar and other foliage feeders. To control these insects, spray Lambda cyhalothrin 4.9CS @ 250 ml/acre.
Remove the borer-affected tillers and late-formed tillers, tie the cane shoots with two or three together with partially dried lower leaves.
To control Top shot borer in sugarcane foliar spray of Fipronil 5SC @400 ml/acre is advised.
In recent rain deficit conditions make necessary irrigation to Brinjal, Chilli, Ridge gourd, Cucumber, and Snake gourd.
For the management of wilting and partial wilting in vegetable plants, apply Neem or Karanjaa cake along with MO P & foliar spray of Tebuconazole @ 1ml/liter can be recommended.
July and August are the ideal time for mango planting.
Suitable varieties are Amrapalli, Dusseheri, Chousa, Baganpalli, Totapuri, Bombay green, Suvarnarekha, Himsagar, etc.

Seedlings should be planted in pits at a distance of 10m X 10m. The pit size is 1m X 1m X 1m. One-year-old healthy grafted plant should be preferred. At the time of planting, two basket compost, 80g N, 100g P 2O5, and 60g K 2O fertilizer should be applied.
Collect 3000 fingerlings per acre pond from a reliable establishment producing fish.
If someone wants to produce three types of fish, release 900 vakur, 1200 rohi, and 900 mirikali twins.
Give sufficient drinking water to animals.
If the animals have not yet been vaccinated against FMD, Haemorrhagic Septicaemia, Black Quarter, Enterotoxemia, etc., these must be done.
